title: Krishna Karunesh appointed Noida Authority CEO amid techie death case probe
content: Following the techie death and protests, Lokesh M. was removed as Noida Authority CEO and placed on the waiting list on January 19

title: Assembly Bill to constitute Special Development Authority in key tourist hubs passed
content: State Government proposed to establish a Special Area Development Authority for areas such as Mamallapuram and Kanniyakumari, considering their historical, ecological and tourism importance in the first phase

title: DMK, the ‘preferred destination’ for many former AIADMK functionaries, compared to TVK
content: Several erstwhile members of the dissidents’ group led by former Chief Minister O. Panneerselvam have also crossed over to the DMK

title: SIR in West Bengal done in hurry, may jeopardise democratic participation: Amartya Sen
content: The Nobel Laureate stressed that such an exercise must be conducted with care and adequate time, conditions he believes are “missing” in West Bengal’s case

title: Ballari model house fire: Eight detained, police say blaze triggered during eel shoot
content: The IGP noted that preliminary inquiry suggested that the incident occurred when the group of boys gained access to the rooftop of the model house to shoot photographs and videos

title: Consultations within party favoured joining NDA, claims Sabu Jacob
content: “Committees had entrusted the party president with making an appropriate decision. During the consultations, 80% supported joining the NDA, a few favoured the UDF, but none wanted to align with the LDF,” says Sabu Jacob

title: Direct assault on judicial independence: Congress slams BJP govt over transfer of Sambhal CJM
content: The CJM's transfer is a textbook example of how the ruling party has "hijacked the judicial system" to serve its political interests, Congress alleged

title: Worker killed after falling into machine at GHMC dumpyard in Yousufguda
content: The deceased was identified as Sudhakar, a resident of Borabanda, who was employed at the dumpyard, the incident occurred while he was carrying out routine work involving the disposal of garbage, says officials

title: Speeding luxury car rams into guardrail during Republic Day rehearsals in Kolkata; driver detained
content: No one injured; seized car did not have a valid insurance and pollution under control (PUC) certificate

title: Revised land market rates to come into effect from February 1 in Anantapur
content: District registrar Bhargav said the State Government had hiked the market values of agriculture, non-agriculture and residential land rates from February 1

title: Andhra’s Lepakshi handicrafts to be distributed in Singapore for Republic Day celebrations
content: “Indian High Commissioner in Singapore has placed an order with Lepakshi for 400 specially curated gift boxes. Each box will showcase traditional Andhra Pradesh crafts,” says  Minister S. Savitha

title: Andhra Pradesh declared as ganja-free cultivation State
content: “EAGLE, in association with Tribal Welfare, Agriculture, Police, Revenue, and other departments have succeeded in preventing ganja cultivation in the tribal habitations in AP,” says the IGP

title: 15 drones, 150 CCTV cameras to monitor Arasavilli temple crowd: Srikakulam SP
content: “As many as six senior officials, including an additional Superintendent of Police, will closely monitor the security arrangements while observing the drones and CCTV footage,” says Srikakulam Superintendent of Police

title: Even BJP government has adopted Tamil Nadu’s schemes, says CM Stalin
content: The Chief Minister said the State’s Health and Family Welfare Department had won the U.N. Interagency Task Force Awards (UNIATF) for 2024 in the category of Ministries of Health for its flagship scheme, Makkalai Thedi Maruthuvam

title: Never violated party line, unapologetic over Operation Sindhoor stance, says Shashi Tharoor
content: Shashi Tharoor added that political parties may have differences as part of the process of building a better India, but when national interests are involved, India must prevail

title: Jonnalapadu: A village steeped in military legacy
content: A tiny village has built a monument chronicling its three generations of military heritage to honour those who fought wars, served on the frontiers and inspire young minds to enlist in defence forces

title: Political or partial treatment of State Governments by Governors is unwarranted: Former Speaker Yanamala
content: “The Constitution does not allow this undemocratic practice, which varies from one State to another,” Yanamala Ramakrishnudu said

title: Three arrested in Devanahalli street fight linked to ragging incident
content: The accused have been identified as Naveen (30), a rowdy-sheeter, and his two accomplices. The police have summoned the other accused and are yet to question them

title: 10-tonne steel bridge on canal stolen overnight in Chhattisgarh's Korba; five held
content: The bridge, around 70 feet long and five feet wide, was built nearly 40 years ago; arrested accused confessed to committing the theft to sell the iron as scrap

title: Practice of linking religion with politics fraught with dangers: Mayawati on Shankracharya row
content: The former Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister's remarks came amid an ongoing row involving the head of Jyotirmath in Badrinath, Swami Avimukteshwaranand, and the Magh Mela administration in Prayagraj

title: Three injured as cut outs collapses ahead of house distribution ceremony in Hubballi
content: Three Persons including a woman have escaped miraculously with some injuries as hug cut outs erected at the mega house distribution event off Mantur Road in Hubballi collapsed on them on Saturday morning

title: Goa seeks to grow as a wellness and medical tourism hub in India
content: Centre’s traditional medicine institute AIIA requests additional 50-acre land for establishing wellness, preventive medicine centre

title: Flight operations resume at Srinagar airport after clearing snow from runway
content: A major snowfall in Kashmir on Friday (January 23, 2026) forced the cancellation of flight operations at the airport as snow accumulated on the runway

title: Trade agreements opening up new opportunities for youth: PM Modi
content: The 18th Rozgar Mela was organised at 45 locations across the country, and newly recruited candidates, selected from all parts of India, joined various ministries and departments of the government

title: Have faced more challenges than Anna, Kalaignar and Jayalalithaa from Governor: CM Stalin in Tamil Nadu Assembly
content: He said he was pained by the attitude of the Governor, who, instead of working for the welfare of the people, was acting against the DMK government, which had been elected to serve them

title: LRS deadline extended for three more months in Andhra Pradesh
content: This is the second time that the State Government has extended the deadline after introducing the scheme last year

title: 76 years ago, 264 Constituent Assembly members signed Indian Constitution: Jairam Ramesh
content: In a post on X, the Congress general secretary also recalled that the members sat together for a group photograph, which "is one for the ages"

title: Telangana CM Revanth Reddy directs T-Hub to remain exclusive Startup hub
content: The Chief Minister responded  to reports suggesting that government offices currently functioning from rented buildings were being considered for relocation to T-Hub

title: Mhow water contamination: Indore administration deploys survey teams, sets up hospitals
content: According to the administration, at least 12 suspected cases of people suffering from stomach infection were detected in the Patti Bazaar area of Mhow

title: Air India to operate new Dreamliner with limitations; awaits certain FAA approvals
content: The aircraft, also the first custom-made Dreamliner to join the Air India fleet after takeover by the Tata Group in January 2022, will enter commercial operations on the Mumbai-Frankfurt route from February 1

title: IndiGo vacated 717 slots at domestic airports after DGCA curtailed winter flights
content: As part of its winter schedule for 2025-26, IndiGo was allowed to operate 15,014 flights per week, which comes to 2,144 flights per day

title: Uttar Pradesh broke free from policy apathy; emerged as India's growth engine: CM Yogi Adityanath
content: In a video message shared on his official X handle, CM Yogi Adityanath said Uttar Pradesh has transformed itself by overcoming long-standing challenges and neglect

title: T.N. government to construct one lakh new houses under Kalaignar Kanavu Illam Scheme
content: The Tamil Nadu Chief Minister added that 33.6 lakh persons had already benefited from the monthly pension scheme ‘Ungaludan Stalin’

title: Special marks for part-time teachers in appointments, says CM Stalin
content: The Tamil Nadu CM also announced an increase in the pension of noon-meal organisers, anganwadi workers, and panchayat union clerks.

title: We will come back to power, CM Stalin declares in Tamil Nadu Assembly
content: The CM said that over the last five years he had “listened to his conscience” and introduced schemes for the people of the State

title: Uttar Pradesh youth amputates foot to seek disability quota in admission to medical college
content: While police saw through his ploy, they are currently seeking legal opinion to determine what sections of criminal law could be levelled against him

title: Shiv Sena Minister’s son surrenders before police
content: Advocate General Milind Sathe on January 23 submitted written communication from Mahad police station, Raigad district, stating that the eight accused, including Vivek and his cousin Mahesh Gogawale, surrendered before the police at 9:15 a.m.

title: Night temperatures drop sharply after spell of rain in New Delhi, air quality sees slight improvement
content: The IMD has also predicted generally cloudy sky and shallow to moderate fog during morning hours, with strong surface winds with speeds ranging from 10-20 kilometres per hour

title: BJD office gheraoed over young MLA’s insistence to know reason behind his suspension
content: The regional party in Odisha has been providing a variety of reasons for suspension of Patkura MLA Arvind Mohapatra

title: Retired IPS officer served notice over allegations against SIT chief
content: In a notice issued on January 23, Commissioner of Police and SIT Chief V.C. Sajjanar stated that Praveen Kumar had alleged that the SIT chief was involved in seven criminal cases and had demanded the constitution of another SIT to inquire into him

title: New office-bearers elected for Madras Bar Association
content: Advocates V.R. Kamalanathan and J. Pothiraj have been elected as the president and secretary of the association established in 1865

title: Actor Kamaal R Khan held for firing at residential building in Mumbai
content: According to the police, two bullets were fired at Nalanda Society in the Oshiwara area of Andheri on January 18

title: Congress questions Maharashtra government’s investment claims at Davos
content: CM claims MoUs worth ₹30 lakh cr signed, but Congress says 70% to 80% of companies involved are not even listed; investment claims from last two years not resulted in industrial activity or jobs on the ground

title: 'Didn't violate party position': Tharoor breaks silence amid rift buzz; defends stand on Op Sindoor
content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor has clarified his stance on party lines. He stated his only public disagreement was on Operation Sindoor and India's counterterrorism position. Tharoor emphasized national interest above political differences. His remarks follow reports of internal party friction and his absence from a key meeting. He recalled past events and leaders' views on national security.

title: Bengali? Yes, SIR. Brahmin? Yes, SIR. Go, fall in line
content: Bengal's voters, including Mukherjees and Banerjees, face hearings over "logical discrepancies" in surnames. The Election Commission's software flags historical variations like Mukhopadhyay for Mukherjee, a simplification by the British. Many now prefer shorter versions, leading to confusion and summons, prompting criticism from CM Mamata Banerjee about cultural insensitivity.

title: 'Better to be an optimist & wrong than pessimist': Larry Fink ends WEF with Musk’s quote
content: The World Economic Forum's annual meeting concluded in Davos, Switzerland. Global leaders from government, business, and academia gathered to discuss pressing geopolitical challenges. Discussions also focused on the transformative power of Artificial Intelligence. Tech leaders shared strategies for AI deployment and its potential to bridge the technology divide. The event highlighted a moment of uncertainty and possibility for global engagement.

title: Accenture's leader-led AI training: Julie Sweet urges hands-on learning
content: Accenture CEO Julie Sweet stresses that leaders must grasp AI to guide their companies through transformation. She advocates for leader-led training, citing a client whose 300 leaders had to directly use AI tools before progress was made. This hands-on approach, starting with top executives, is crucial for unlocking AI's potential and ensuring widespread adoption across all sectors.

title: 'Palash Muchhal got beaten up': Smriti Mandhana's childhood friend makes shock claim
content: A wedding cancellation has sparked controversy. Actor-producer Vidnyan Mane has leveled serious accusations against singer-composer Palaash Muchhal. Mane claims infidelity and financial misconduct. He alleges being cheated of over Rs 40 lakh. A formal complaint has been filed in Sangli, Maharashtra. Muchhal has denied all allegations. Both parties have confirmed the wedding's cancellation.

title: 'I wanted to scream': Two sisters share their story of agony, pain & fight against it
content: When both parents suffered strokes a year apart, twin sisters Aishwarya and Apoorva became caregivers, transforming their Mumbai home into a testament to courage and resilience. They navigated medical crises, emotional turmoil, and the profound reversal of roles, ultimately finding strength and deeper bonds through unwavering love and support for their parents.

title: Children hid in closet: Indian national, 3 relatives shot dead in family dispute in US
content: An Indian national was among four people killed in a Georgia shooting linked to an alleged family dispute. Police identified the suspect as Vijay Kumar, who has been charged with multiple counts, including murder. Three children were found unharmed inside the residence and are now in family care.

title: Amazon layoffs: Company to cut 14,000 more jobs
content: Amazon is planning to cut approximately 14,000 corporate jobs starting next week, marking the second major layoff wave since October and bringing total reductions to 30,000 roles. CEO Andy Jassy clarified the cuts aren't driven by AI or financial concerns but by excessive bureaucracy and organizational layers. The layoffs will affect employees across AWS, retail, Prime Video, and human resources divisions, representing nearly 10% of Amazon's corporate workforce.

title: Ishan Kishan: A man on a mission - 'Don’t let this knock get into your head'
content: Ishan Kishan’s 32 ball 76 at the Shaheed Veer Narayan Singh International Stadium in Raipur was a reminder of his talent and how the previous management, led by Rohit Sharma, coach Rahul Dravid and the current chief selector Ajit Agarkar, isolated a talent whose only mistake was asking for clarity on his role in the team and a break due to mental fatigue. But that is in the past. After spending two years away from the set-up, he has earned his stripes and clearly looks like a man on a mission.

title: Vande Bharat dashing through snow: Vaishnaw shares stunning video of winter-ready train
content: The Vande Bharat Express is now operating in Kashmir, specially modified with winter-ready features to handle sub-zero temperatures. Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw shared a video of the train moving through snow, highlighting its advanced heating systems and driver safety enhancements. This development ensures all-weather rail connectivity for the region.

title: Ammonia spike in Yamuna disrupts tap supply across city; residents may struggle till February
content: Thousands of Delhi households face prolonged water disruption as treatment plants operate below capacity due to high ammonia levels in the Yamuna. Residents report dry taps for days, relying on expensive water cans, with concerns the crisis could extend into next month.  The situation is exacerbated by canal closures and a lack of dedicated ammonia removal facilities.

title: Davos 2026: Musk, Trump reconcile at memorial; policy rift on US solar energy emerges
content: Elon Musk and Donald Trump have reportedly reconciled, attending a memorial together in September 2025.  Despite this apparent truce, Musk recently diverged from Trump's stance on energy at the World Economic Forum, advocating for solar power to meet America's growing electricity demands, a move contrasting with Trump's pro-oil policies.

title: Penguins in Greenland? The story behind the viral ‘Nihilist Penguin’ meme
content: President Trump's AI-generated image of a penguin in Greenland, featuring a geographical error, has gone viral. This coincides with a resurfaced documentary clip of a lone penguin, dubbed 'Nihilist Penguin,' sparking online debate about existentialism and rebellion, though scientists attribute the behavior to disorientation or illness.

title: Tinder match, suitcase murder and now wedding: Convicted killer Priya Seth ties knot
content: Murder convicts Priya Seth and Hanuman Prasad were forced to change their wedding venue from Alwar's Barodameo town due to intense media and public scrutiny after their wedding card went viral. The couple, both serving life sentences, tied the knot at an undisclosed location on Friday, with their lawyer confirming the ceremony proceeded as planned despite the venue change.

title: ‘Not inferior to anyone in patriotism’: Stalin hits out at TN governor
content: Tamil Nadu chief minister MK Stalin sharply criticized governor RN Ravi in the state assembly, accusing him of undermining constitutional conventions by refusing to read his customary address. Stalin highlighted the Dravidian model government's achievements and dismissed law and order concerns.

title: Josh Allen injury update: Bills QB faces uncertainty amid possible surgery concerns
content: Buffalo Bills General Manager Brandon Beane has provided an update about Josh Allen's injury. According to him, the star QB may undergo right-foot surgery. Furthermore, the Bills have faced a serious crisis on their offensive line. The star quarterback has injured himself in their last game against the Denver Broncos.

title: Reggie Miller says Stephen Curry should call Giannis as Father Time looms
content: Reggie Miller urged Stephen Curry to recruit Giannis Antetokounmpo to the Warriors, citing Milwaukee's struggles and the Warriors' need for star power after Jimmy Butler's injury. Miller believes this blockbuster move could save Curry's prime and reshape the league, combining two of the game's biggest stars for a championship push.

title: Ray Daniels sparks outrage with explosive LeBron–Kobe comparison
content: Music executive Ray Daniels faced widespread backlash with a controversial statement comparing LeBron James and Kobe Bryant, suggesting Bryant had a "daddy" while James did not. This personal remark, made on his podcast, shifted the debate from basketball to respect and boundaries, drawing sharp criticism from fans who deemed it unnecessary and attention-seeking.

title: 'He hit me, so I shot him dead’: Chilling confession after 24-yr-old gunned down in Delhi cafe
content: A 24-year-old man, Faizan, was fatally shot in a targeted cafe attack in northeast Delhi. A chilling confession video emerged, with a suspect claiming personal revenge for a past insult, denying family involvement or financial motives. Faizan's brother alleges a prolonged dispute and accuses both the suspect and his father, seeking swift justice.

title: Sabotage? Explosion damages Amritsar–Delhi railway line in Fatehgarh Sahib; loco pilot injured
content: A suspected sabotage incident rocked the Amritsar-Delhi railway line in Punjab late Friday night. An explosion near Khanpur village, Fatehgarh Sahib, damaged approximately 12 feet of track, injuring a freight train's loco pilot. Authorities are investigating the blast, which occurred around 12:30 am Saturday. Restoration efforts are underway with enhanced security.

title: IndiGo vacates over 700 slots at domestic airports after DGCA's 10% cut order
content: IndiGo has released over 700 airport slots nationwide, including major metros like Delhi and Mumbai, following a DGCA-mandated 10% cut to its winter schedule. This action aims to curb disruptions after thousands of passengers were affected by cancellations and delays in early December. Other airlines are now invited to utilize these released slots.

title: US winter storm: Air India cancels all flights from New York, New Jersey on Jan 25-26; details
content: Air India has cancelled all flights to and from New York and Newark on January 25 and 26 due to a severe winter storm forecast. The airline cited safety concerns for passengers and crew as the storm is expected to bring heavy snowfall and icy conditions to the US East Coast.

title: New fissure? After Greenland thaw, Trump-Europe tensions reignite — what triggered row this time
content: President Trump's remarks questioning NATO allies' sacrifices in Afghanistan and their commitment to the US have ignited anger across Europe. Leaders from the UK, France, and Poland have strongly rebuked the comments, highlighting their own significant losses and unwavering support for the alliance. This latest dispute underscores growing European concerns about a transactional US foreign policy.

title: Bills fans rally to bring back former head coach Sean McDermott days after dismissal
content: A passionate Buffalo Bills fan, Maria Maisonet, created a Change.org petition to reinstate head coach Sean McDermott, accumulating over 45,000 signatures. The fan believes McDermott’s dismissal is short-sighted, overlooking his contributions and player respect. She argues McDermott deserves a chance to coach in the new stadium [New Highmark Stadium]. Bills owner Terry Pegula sensed something in the locker room, which led to McDermott’s firing.

title: Budget 2026: What banks and financial services expect from FM this time?
content: The banking sector anticipates targeted policy support in Union Budget 2026 to address credit constraints and rising NPAs in unsecured loans. Key expectations include enhanced MSME credit guarantees, co-lending schemes, and continued digital financial inclusion support. The industry also seeks incentives for pension and insurance adoption and regulatory relief for rural banks.

title: Diary entry reveals why a NEET aspirant from UP amputated his foot
content: A 24-year-old man from Jaunpur allegedly severed part of his left foot to claim disability benefits for NEET medical admission. Initially reporting an attack, police uncovered his motive through his diary and girlfriend's statement, revealing his desperation for MBBS admission. He reportedly used a machine and possibly anesthetics for the act.

title: Revealed! Why Suryakumar Yadav was angry at Ishan Kishan
content: Suryakumar Yadav lauded Ishan Kishan's fearless batting after India's seven-wicket win over New Zealand.  Kishan's aggressive 76 and Yadav's 82 powered a remarkable chase, reflecting the team's desired free-flowing approach. Despite bowling struggles, the team restricted New Zealand to a manageable total.

title: 'Surgical, kinetic ... ': Iran warns US of 'all-out war' over 'military build-up' in Middle East
content: Iran has issued a stern warning, stating any attack will be treated as an all-out war, amid the deployment of a US aircraft carrier strike group and other military assets to the Middle East. Tehran's military is on high alert, prepared for the worst-case scenario as tensions escalate following US-backed Israeli strikes and President Trump's close watch on Iran.

title: 'Scolded for returning drunk': BTech student dies after jumping from Greater Noida hostel
content: A 20-year-old BTech student, Udit Soni, died after jumping from the fourth floor of EZ Stays hostel in Greater Noida. Police reported the incident occurred after the hostel manager scolded him for returning drunk. Authorities have taken custody of the body and are investigating the circumstances.

title: Illinois siblings suffer from Sanfilippo syndrome: Doctor explains the rare disorder
content: An Illinois couple is raising two children, Poppy and Oliver, who suffer from Sanfilippo syndrome, a rare genetic disorder also known as childhood dementia. This condition causes a progressive decline in cognitive and motor skills, leading to significant challenges for affected families. Currently, there is no cure, and treatments focus on managing symptoms and exploring new therapies.

title: Gujarat University appoints chemistry professor as English HOD
content: Hemchandracharya North Gujarat University faced legal challenges after appointing a chemistry professor as the in-charge head of its English department. A court questioned the university's decision, leading to the reversal of the appointment. The aggrieved faculty member can now challenge the new proposed head.

title: Will rain continue in Delhi-NCR? IMD forecasts dip in minimum temperature
content: New Delhi experienced its highest single-day rainfall in January in three years on Friday, with 13.2 mm recorded. Overcast skies and gusty winds kept temperatures unusually high for the minimum and low for the maximum. While a dip in minimum temperatures is expected, coldwave conditions are unlikely.

title: 7 riders, 1 bike, zero sense: VIP Road viral video stuns netizens; cops launch probe to identify youths
content: Seven young men were filmed riding a single motorcycle without helmets on Bhopal's VIP Road, a video that has gone viral. The reckless stunt, captured in broad daylight amidst heavy traffic, has sparked outrage online. Authorities are investigating the incident, reviewing CCTV footage to identify the individuals and the vehicle involved.

title: 'Palash Muchhal was caught red-handed': Smriti Mandhana's childhood friend makes big claim
content: Actor-producer Vidnyan Mane has accused singer-composer Palaash Muchhal of infidelity and financial misconduct, leading to a police complaint in Sangli, Maharashtra. Mane alleges Muchhal was caught with another woman during wedding festivities and claims he was cheated of over Rs 40 lakh in a film project. Muchhal has denied all accusations, calling them baseless and factually incorrect.

title: Masseuse assaults woman for cancelling treatment in Mumbai's Wadala; video goes viral
content: A Mumbai woman alleges she was assaulted by a massage therapist from an app-based service after cancelling a session midway due to discomfort. The therapist reportedly became enraged, verbally abused, and physically attacked the 46-year-old victim in Wadala. Police are investigating the incident, with a video of the event circulating online.

title: ‘China will eat them up’: Trump slams Canada over pushback on ‘Golden Dome’ plan in Greenland
content: US President Donald Trump criticized Canada for opposing his "Golden Dome" missile defense system over Greenland, accusing Ottawa of prioritizing economic ties with China. Trump asserted Canada's security relies on the US, a claim rejected by Canadian PM Mark Carney, who emphasized Canadian sovereignty and thriving independently. The dispute highlights ongoing bilateral tensions and differing approaches to international relations.

title: UAE orders release for 900+ Indian prisoners ahead of National Day
content: The UAE has released over 900 Indian prisoners as part of a humanitarian pardon ordered by President Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan. This significant gesture, coinciding with National Day celebrations, includes the clearing of financial penalties, enabling a genuine fresh start for the inmates. The release strengthens the deep-rooted brotherhood and goodwill between the UAE and India.

title: The question that brought Ishan Kishan back: 'Can I do it or not?'
content: Ishan Kishan's powerful 76 off 32 balls marked a triumphant return to the Indian jersey after a two-year hiatus.  He rediscovered his form through domestic cricket, answering his own doubts about his capability to perform at the international level.  Kishan's confident mindset and strategic approach were key to chasing a daunting target.

title: Actor Kamaal R Khan arrested by Mumbai police for firing incident at residential building
content: Actor Kamaal Rashid Khan, also known as KRK, was reportedly arrested on Saturday in connection with a firing incident. He allegedly admitted to firing two rounds from his licensed firearm at a residential building in Mumbai's Oshiwara area on January 18. No casualties were reported in the incident.

title: Donna Kelce sparks Travis Kelce retirement rumors, wedding plans on hold
content: Donna Kelce shared a Times Square billboard promoting a new Kelce brothers project tied to their New Heights podcast, drawing attention as Travis Kelce weighs retirement. While remaining quiet about his NFL future, Travis continues expanding his off field ventures. A recent excited comment about the Chiefs’ coaching move has further fueled speculation that he may return next season.

title: Will stop BMC chief’s salary if AQI doesn’t improve: Bombay HC
content: Bombay High Court has sternly criticized the BMC for its lax approach to Mumbai's pollution control, threatening to withhold the municipal commissioner's salary. Judges noted a lack of sincere effort and a "belligerent disregard" for court orders, particularly regarding Navi Mumbai's affidavit. This strong stance signals a potential financial penalty for non-compliance.

title: Still eyeing the Arctic? White House posts AI image of Trump with penguin in Greenland
content: President Trump is intensifying his focus on Greenland, with the White House releasing an AI-generated image of him with a penguin to highlight the strategic importance of the Arctic island. Trump has cited security concerns regarding Russia and China, sparking backlash from allies. He also criticized Canada's opposition to a missile defense project, warning of Chinese influence.

title: India knows how to manage power responsibly: PM Modi
content: The Prime Minister was addressing a function to celebrate Parakram Diwas, the birth anniversary of Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose

title: Republic Day Parade to see many firsts: Suryastra system, Bhairav Battalion, Bactrian camels
content: Major General Navraj Dhillon, Chief of Staff, Delhi Area, told reporters that about 6,000 defence personnel will be part of the parade

title: First separate budgets of city corporations to focus on parks, lakes and welfare funds
content: One of the focus areas in this year’s budgets will be municipal bonds, which allow urban local bodies to raise long-term funds directly from the market for capital-intensive infrastructure works such as roads, drains, parks and lakes.

title: Wife can’t claim maintenance if her action contributes to husband’s incapacity to earn: Allahabad High Court
content: The Court dismissed a revision petition of a woman seeking maintenance from her husband, a homeopathy doctor, who was allegedly shot at by his brother-in-law and father-in-law during an altercation at his clinic

title: School students taken on flight to Coimbatore
content: At Coimbatore, the Rotary Club of Coimbatore East (RI District 3206) and the Rotaract Club of PSGR Krishnammal College for Women stepped in to organise events for the students

title: Busy schedule awaits Naidu in Nagari today
content: Mr. Naidu’s visit assumed political significance as Nagari was a YSRCP stronghold between 2014 and 2024, represented by former MLA R.K. Roja

title: BIE organises PTM across 430 junior colleges
content: The BIE has also been providing free online coaching for competitive exams such as JEE, NEET, and CLAT in collaboration with Physics Wallah and Khan Academy.

title: Priyank Kharge writes to Centre to release pending grants for Gram Panchayats
content: The minister said that the central Government has been delaying the release of the grants for the financial year 2025-26, despite the state government’s timely submission of grant transfer certificates and Gram Panchayat Development plans.

title: Kerala man’s death: Trial by social media
content: A day after a woman posted a video on social media alleging sexual harassment by a man on a bus, he died by suicide. The episode sparked outrage across Kerala and led to heated discussions on the use of social media, the possible consequences of public shaming, and mental health. Mini Muringatheri reports on an episode that has divided society

title: Poll bodies of 42 nations to work together on key issues
content: The participants also resolved to review their progress periodically and proposed to meet from December 3-5, 2026 at the India International Institute of Democracy and Election Management (IIIDEM)

title: TMC MP petitions EC over special revision of electoral rolls in Assam
content: In a letter addressed to Chief Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar, the Rajya Sabha member warned that the electoral process, executed hurriedly, could lead to “large-scale wrongful deletion” of names

title: IWDC puts Kerala in focus with major waterway projects
content: The package announced for the State at third council meeting includes development of river cruise jetties, induction of a survey vessel, and measures to strengthen capacity for passenger movement

title: Harish Rao alleges more scams in Singareni, demands judicial or CBI probe
content: The BRS leader says there is a ₹500 cr. scam in solar power plants as contracts were given at ₹5.04 cr. to ₹7.16 cr. per MW against national average of ₹3-4 cr.

title: Delimitation after 2027, redrawing power in India
content: If done poorly, driven by political arithmetic alone, it can deepen distrust and injure India’s federal spirit

title: South India’s tier 2, tier 3 residential sales value crosses ₹20,000 cr. in 2025
content: Despite improvement in deliveries, permissions, e-Khata processes and power connections continue to face bureaucratic bottlenecks that push up finance costs and slow down handovers, says CREDAI

title: Kerala declares Bacillus subtilis ‘State microbe’
content: Kerala the first State in the country to officially declare its own State microbe. Chief Minister dedicates to the people Centre of Excellence in Microbiome, which will scientifically study the role of microorganisms in health and environment

title: Diversify your fish basket to woo new markets: from rohu, catla to scampi, tilapia, pangasius
content: Fisheries Ministry also pushes for cultivation of a wider variety of species to reduce the risk of disease wiping out a single species; urges States to find new markets, adopt new technologies

title: India, EU to upgrade ties at Delhi summit, but still working out trade deal
content: Deeper cooperation is expected to be announced across various dimensions, including climate change, supply chains and critical minerals, humanitarian assistance and disaster relief, as well as cooperation at multilateral forums

title: Union Home Secretary asks States to not affect any jurisdictional changes till March 31, 2027
content: He asks States to ensure timely appointment and training of Census functionaries, effective use of digital tools, and a focused publicity and communication approach

title: 71 fugitives located abroad in 2024-25, highest in 12 years
content: DoPT data shows only 27 fugitives returned to India in 2025; India has extradition treaties with 48 countries; as on March 31, 2025, there were 533 letters rogatory from India pending with other countries

title: The Hindu, VIT Chennai to organise webinar series on careers in biotechnology in industry
content: A series of webinars will explore innovations in healthcare, agriculture, environment, and advanced manufacturing, while also addressing challenges such as sustainability, resilience, and inclusive growth

title: Netaji’s strategic vision more relevant than ever in today’s unstable world: CDS General Anil Chauhan
content: Delivering an address at Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) on the birth anniversary of Netaji, General Chauhan said Bose exemplified the seamless integration of political vision, astute diplomacy and military operations

title: Top JeM terrorist killed in encounter in J&K’s Kathua
content: Officials identified the deceased terrorist as JeM commander Usman alias ‘Abu Maviya’. They said a large quantity of arms and ammunition, including an M4 automatic rifle, were recovered during the operation in a remote village in Parhetar area

title: Walkouts by Governors test constitutional limits

title: Transport stakeholders divided over bike taxi services after court order
content: While bike taxi riders welcomed the High Court’s order, auto-rickshaw unions and transport associations expressed concern over safety risks and the economic impact on thousands of families dependent on traditional transport services.

title: Ambitious scheme to spur next-gen battery manufacturing in India stumbles
content: Delays in visa approvals for Chinese technical specialists, requirements that mandate local manufacturing, and the lack of critical technologies threaten the government’s Advanced Chemistry Cell Production Linked Incentive scheme, says report

title: President inaugurates Granth Kutir at Rashtrapati Bhavan
content: Granth Kutir (book house) has a rich collection of manuscripts and books in 11 classical languages of India, including Tamil, Sanskrit, Kannada, Malayalam, Odia, Marathi, Pali, Prakrit, Assamese, and Bengali

title: Giannis expects to miss 4-6 weeks with calf injury
content: Bucks star Giannis Antetokounmpo will undergo an MRI on his right calf but said he expects the injury to sideline him for at least four to six weeks.

title: Dabo rips Ole Miss for 'blatant' tampering with LB

title: Study finds strikes disrupt satellite signals; causes possible GPS errors — here's how
content: Chethan Kumar is a Senior Assistant Editor with the Times of India. Aside from specialising in Space & Science, he has reported extensively on varied topics, with special focus on defence, policy and data stories. He has covered multiple elections, too. As a young democracy grows out of adolescence, Chethan feels, there are reels of tales emerging which need to be captured. To do this, he alternates between the mundane goings-on of the Common Man and the wonder-filled worlds of scientists and scamsters, politicians and soldiers. In a career spanning nearly 18 years, he has reported from multiple datelines — Houston, Florida, Kochi, Hyderabad, Chennai, Sriharikota (AP), NH-1 (J&K Highway), New Delhi, Ahmedabad, Raichur, Bhatkal, Mysuru, Chamarajanagar, to name a few —  but is based out of Bengaluru, India’s science capital that also hosts the ISRO HQ. title: Delhi Cops Bust Fake KYC Updates Scam Targeting Bank Customers, 4 Arrested
content: The Delhi Police has busted a major multi-state cyber-fraud syndicate allegedly involved in duping bank customers on the pretext of updating their KYC details and arrested four men from Jharkhand and West Bengal, an official said on Saturday.

title: TikTok Strikes US Deal After Years Of Uncertainty. What To Know
content: TikTok has at last finalized a deal to keep the popular video sharing platform operating in the US after years of uncertainty, but questions remain about whether users' experience will change and whether the changes actually address security concerns

title: How A Timely Call Saved 3 Children From Indian Family Massacre In US
content: A tragedy dawned upon an Indian family living in the US yesterday, with a family dispute turning deadly. An Indian woman and her three Indian-origin relatives were shot dead, allegedly by her husband, Vijay Kumar, in the state of Georgia.

title: US Completes Withdrawal From World Health Organization
content: The US has finalised its withdrawal from the World Health Organization, one year after President Donald Trump announced America was ending its 78-year-old commitment, federal officials said.

title: Air India Cancels New York, Newark Flights Ahead Of US Winter Storm
content: Air India has issued a travel advisory ahead of the severe winter storm forecasted for the US East Coast.

title: Shock, Anger As Owner Of Swiss Bar, Where Fire Killed 40 People, Bailed
content: The co-owner of the Swiss bar hit by a deadly fire during New Year celebrations was released from custody on Friday after bail was paid on his behalf, dismaying victims' families.

title: France Probes Deaths Of Two Babies After Powdered Milk Recall
content: France's health minister sought to reassure consumers that all suspicious infant formula had been withdrawn, as an investigation began into the deaths of two babies who drank possibly contaminated powdered milk.

title: Open Pits, Dark Roads: NDTV Surveys Noida's Hazardous Traps After Techie Death

title: Odisha Man, 75, Attempts To Burn Daughter-In-Law For Giving Birth To Girl
content: A man allegedly attempted to burn his daughter-in-law for giving birth to a baby girl in the Damarpur village of Odisha's Kendrapara district.

title: Who Is Vijay Kumar, Indian-Origin Man Who Massacred Wife, 3 Relatives In US
content: An Indian-origin man has been arrested for allegedly killing his wife and three relatives in Lawrenceville, Georgia.Vijay Kumar, 51, is said to have shot his wife, an Indian national, and three other adults following a domestic dispute, police said.

title: Chandrababu Naidu Showcases Andhra As Hub For Global Investments At Davos
content: Andhra Pradesh has initiated at least 25 new policies for industrial development and is encouraging investments in digital media and virtual production, Chief Minister N Chandrababu Naidu has said in multiple interactions in Davos.

title: IndiGo Vacated 717 Domestic Slots After Aviation Regulator Cuts Winter Flights
content: IndiGo has vacated more than 700 slots at various domestic airports, following aviation watchdog DGCA curtailing the country's largest airline's winter flights by 10 per cent after massive operational disruptions in early December.

content: Scott Bessent said that Indian refinery purchases of Russian oil have "collapsed" due to US tariffs, hinting that, while tariffs remain in place, a diplomatic "path" exists to remove them.

title: 12-Year-Old Australian Boy Dies After Shark Attack In Sydney Harbour

content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor on Saturday said he has never violated the party's stated positions in Parliament, asserting that his only public disagreement in principle was over Operation Sindhoor.

title: Suicide Bomber Triggered Blast Mid-Air On A Commercial Plane. Only He Died
content: A decade ago, on February 2, 2016, a Somali suicide bomber triggered a blast inside Daallo Airlines Flight 159, heading from Mogadishu to Djibouti. In what was nothing short of a miracle, only the bomber was killed.
